required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Seroprevalence of Bordetella Pertussis in Adults in Hungary
clinical_study.official_title: Seroprevalence of Bordetella Pertussis in Adults in Hungary

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to perform an epidemiological survey of the adult population in Hungary to calculate the seroprevalence of pertussis.

detailed_description.textblock: The protocol posting was amended to correct the detailed title. Since a sample of blood will be collected from all subjects (outside of routine hospital procedure), the study does not meet GSK's definition of an observational study and hence the term "observational" was deleted from the detailed title.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-pertussis Toxin (Anti-PT) Concentrations
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 Optical Density (OD) units)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Strongly Indicative of Current/Recent Infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels strongly indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.5 OD units

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Age)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0).
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Strongly Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Age)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels strongly indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.5 OD units

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Age)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Age)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Gender)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Strongly Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Gender)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels strongly indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.5 OD units

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Gender)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Gender)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Gender)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Recent History of Long-lasting Cough)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units). A long-lasting cough was defined as any cough that lasted for more than (≥) 3 weeks in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Recent History of Long-lasting Cough)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units). A long-lasting cough was defined as any cough that lasted for more than (≥) 3 weeks in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Recent History of Long-lasting Cough)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units. A long-lasting cough was defined as any cough that lasted for more than (≥) 3 weeks in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Recent History of Long-lasting Cough)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units. A long-lasting cough was defined as any cough that lasted for more than (≥) 3 weeks in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Smoking Status)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Smoking Status)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Smoking Status)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Smoking Status)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by History of Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by History of Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by History of Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by History of Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by History of Vaccination Against Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by History of Vaccination Against Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by History of Vaccination Against Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by History of Vaccination Against Pertussis)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Medication)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units). Medication included any antibiotics and/or other medication (i.e. any cough medicines) for lower respiratory tract infections, Pertussis infections or suspected Pertussis infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Medication)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units). Medication included any antibiotics and/or other medication (i.e. any cough medicines) for lower respiratory tract infections, Pertussis infections or suspected Pertussis infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Medication)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units. Medication included any antibiotics and/or other medication (i.e. any cough medicines) for lower respiratory tract infections, Pertussis infections or suspected Pertussis infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Medication)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units. Medication included any antibiotics and/or other medication (i.e. any cough medicines) for lower respiratory tract infections, Pertussis infections or suspected Pertussis infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Hospitalization)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units). History of hospitalization was defined as hospitalization due to respiratory infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seronegative Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Hospitalization)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: Seronegativity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels under the sensitivity limit of the assay (≤ 0.3 OD units). History of hospitalization was defined as hospitalization due to respiratory infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Hospitalization)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels indicative of current/recent infection was greater than or equal to (≥) 1.0 OD units. History of hospitalization was defined as hospitalization due to respiratory infections in the previous 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Hospitalization)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units. History of hospitalization was defined as hospitalization due to respiratory infections in the previous 12 months.

arm_group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 18 years and above who had agreed to collection of blood sample.

intervention.description: A blood sample (2.5 mL) will be collected from all subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- Written informed consent will be obtained from subjects prior to performing any study procedures.
- Males or females ≥ 18 years of age at the time of enrollment.
- Agreeing to collection of a blood sample for the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
• Confirmed or suspected immunological disorder.

reference.citation: Torzsa P, Devadiga R, Tafalla M. Seroprevalence of Bordetella pertussis antibodies in adults in Hungary: results of an epidemiological cross-sectional study. BMC Infect Dis. 2017 Apr 4;17(1):242. doi: 10.1186/s12879-017-2356-2.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD for this study will be made available via the Clinical Study Data Request site.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD is available via the Clinical Study Data Request site (click on the link provided below)
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access is provided after a research proposal is submitted and has received approval from the Independent Review Panel and after a Data Sharing Agreement is in place. Access is provided for an initial period of 12 months but an extension can be granted, when justified, for up to another 12 months.

group.title: Study Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 18 years and above who had agreed to collection of blood sample.

group.title: Study Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 18 years and above who had agreed to collection of blood sample.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-pertussis Toxin (Anti-PT) Concentrations
outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 Optical Density (OD) units)
outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort included all evaluable subjects for whom valid laboratory test results for anti-pertussis toxin antibodies were available.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Recent History of Long-lasting Cough)
outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units). A long-lasting cough was defined as any cough that lasted for more than (≥) 3 weeks in the previous 12 months.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort included all evaluable subjects for whom valid laboratory test results for anti-pertussis toxin antibodies were available and who provided information on recent history of long-lasting cough.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects in Terms of Anti-PT Concentrations (by Medication)
outcome.description: Seropositivity was defined as anti-PT IgG levels above the sensitivity limit of the assay (> 0.3 OD units). Medication included any antibiotics and/or other medication (i.e. any cough medicines) for lower respiratory tract infections, Pertussis infections or suspected Pertussis infections in the previous 12 months.
outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort included all evaluable subjects for whom valid laboratory test results for anti-pertussis toxin antibodies were available and who provided information on their medication history.

outcome.time_frame: At the time of enrollment of each subject (Day 0)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort included all evaluable subjects for whom valid laboratory test results for anti-pertussis toxin antibodies were available and who provided information on their hospitalization history.

group.title: Study Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 18 years and above who had agreed to collection of blood sample.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Anti-PT IgG Levels Not Indicative of Current/Recent Infection (by Hospitalization)
measure.description: The cut-off value for anti-PT IgG levels not indicative of current/recent infection was smaller than (<) 1.0 OD units. History of hospitalization was defined as hospitalization due to respiratory infections in the previous 12 months.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort included all evaluable subjects for whom valid laboratory test results for anti-pertussis toxin antibodies were available and who provided information on their hospitalization history.

reported_events.time_frame: Day 0 (all study procedures were performed and completed at the first and only visit in this study)
reported_events.desc: Other [Not Including Serious] Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed.

group.title: Study Group
group.description: Subjects, male and female, aged 18 years and above who had agreed to collection of blood sample.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
